summary: OFC it has to be pink
mainText: 'ofc' by Polina

summary: Polina says the video yesterday was 1hr sped up to 10 minutes.
mainText: 'it was speed up from 1hr to 10min üòÖ yeah, will make a few simpler ones!' by Polina

summary: Textures can only be changed outside of Hytale
mainText: 'textures (as in actual ‚Äûpng‚Äú) you can only change outside, in software like paint, photoshop, etc' by Polina

summary: As far as Polina is aware, everything from the Block Tech article is still in-game.
mainText: 'afaik this is all still in game, but depending on which blogpost you are referring, some things might not be there. Tints and transitions all there' by Polina

summary: Polina says particles can be focused on a precise area
mainText: 'yes! you would actually attach it on the sword in this case (or next to mobs hand on a mob)' by Polina

summary: Polina says particle system logic is pretty standard
mainText: 'In the particle system itself the supported logic is pretty standard, like, there are delays. But particles dont ‚Äûknow‚Äú you opened a door, for example, but you can spawn particles on opening, configured in the door itself' by Polina

summary: Polina says effects can be spawn on specific interactions, attached to items/blocks/mobs.
mainText: 'Effects are largely integrated in gameplay systems, so, for example you can spawn an effect on specific interaction, attach it to items (e.g torch), blocks, mobs (e.g emberwulf). It‚Äôs still not finished and more functionality will come!' by Polina

summary: Simon says Raptors have default AI, needs work to add interesting behaviors, but there's a 2K+ ticket backlog.
mainText: 'Just checked: the Raptor has a default basic AI parented; it needs to be worked on config-wise to feel more raptor-like. Reasonably easy to add interesting behaviours, someone just needs to get to it at some point in the 2000+ tickets backlog ' by Simon

summary: Simon says Raptor AI needs fix.
mainText: 'NOTE: Raptor NPC AI is horrible, time to put fix in queue' by Simon

summary: Propzie jokes about the gameplay
mainText: 'It seems I'm the one on the menu. üòÖ' by Propzie

summary: Simon jokes about backlogging KC
mainText: 'but then Slikey will release his blog and you will be backlogged bro' by Simon

summary: Simon says he will find the list of MVP+ after launch when he gets a minute.
mainText:
'I don't have exact plans but I have not forgotten them.
I will find that list again after launch when I get a minute.' by Simon

summary: Simon is keeping his promise of a storm.
mainText: 'I told you guys it would be a storm, a storm of info!' by Simon

summary: Simon says next week is testing week, with a release date by the end of the week. Pricing details tomorrow.
mainText:
'Starting next week, we will test Hytale across different hardware to determine the minimum specs, fix major crashes, improve overall security, test the launcher and finish up legal work to get the game ready for early access.

By the end of that week, we will announce a precise release date.

Tomorrow, we will announce Hytale pricing details

Later today, 
@slikey_dev
  will post a blog about modding!' by Simon

summary: Simon celebrates Zone 4
mainText: 'Zone 4 IS BACK ON THE MENU BOIS' by Simon

summary: "Don't go to Zone 4 unprepared!"
mainText:
'Don't go to Zone 4 unprepared üòÖ #Hytale' by Hytale

(Dinosaurs raptors zone 4 cave)

summary: Simon says 90% of the beta signups were lost in acquisitions, but there won't be a beta so it doesn't matter.
mainText:
'90%+ of the emails were lost in the acquisition. Unfortunately, there are no solutions because of how regulation works.

However, there is no beta, we are going straight up to early access :P
Doesn't matter anymore, except for those who don't know about the recent news, so we will ask our community to spread the word when the time comes.' by Simon

summary: Simon spent "the most" on Hytale
mainText: 'I spent the most on Hytale' by Simon

mainText: 'I was playing a broken build with less animal spawning, there was actually too many of them before, poop everywhereüòÖ' by Simon

mainText: 'They are not ‚Äúdungeons‚Äù üëÄ' by Simon

summary: Simon corrects fan guess at mob count in Hytale

summary: Simon corrects date
mainText: 'Oh right 2012, but server went up 2013' by Simon

summary: Simon says he hasn't had a single day off for three months
mainText: 'Not a single day off for 3 months, feels like 2013 when I created Hypixel' by Simon

summary: Simon talks about sleep schedule
mainText: 'My sleep schedule absolutely destroyed but working on Hytale is the best, love the pressure, love the game, can‚Äôt wait to share more' by Simon

summary: Simon talks about Dwarf Fortress
mainText: 'Imagine that game in 3D bro' by Simon

summary: Simon shares his "research" materials during retirement.
mainText: 'I played a lot of WoW, Path of Exile 2, Valheim, Baldur Gates 3, Satisfactory, Rim World, Dwarf Fortress, dark souls, ton or roguelikes and many more, so in a way I was studying üòâ' by Simon

summary: Simon says everyday, something new will be shared.
mainText: 'everyday something new' by Simon

summary: Launcher background might change for major updates
mainText: 'maybe for major updates yeah' by Simon

summary: Simon has shared Hytale Launcher first look in Discord
mainText: 'Just posted launcher screenshot / video on discord in showcase channel' by Simon

summary: Simon explains "couple days" wording
mainText: 'oh, I mean its still a couple days technically!' by Simon

summary: Simon says there haven't been delays
mainText: 'There haven‚Äôt been any delays yet? I haven‚Äôt announced anything üòÇ' by Simon

summary: Simon comments on size of Discord
mainText:
'Almost 100,000 on Hytale discord in less than 72 hours.

Will do Q&A next week, see you there ü´°' by Simon

summary: Names will be unique
mainText: 'Unique' by Simon

summary: Simon jokes about tweeting news at 3 AM
mainText: 'Meme gif, bleary cat staring into camera' by Simon

summary: Simon says he won't move to California
mainText: 'brother I barely left my house when retired üòÇ' by Simon

summary: Simon explains that there is no campaign; who E.A. is for.
mainText:
'There is no campaign. This is early access exploration mode, its barebone and not good yet!

Early access is meant for those who support the original vision to keep going forward with adventure mode and everything else shown in the trailer.' by Simon

summary: Simon says user is underestimating how much $ he put into saving Hytale
mainText: 'You are underestimating how much I put into this üòÇ' by Simon

summary: Simon explains his pricing thoughts
mainText:
'For transparency, I‚Äôm trying to keep the base price as low as possible so more of you can play Hytale. At the same time, I need to factor in the buyback price, legal fees, and production costs.

I‚Äôm not going to recoup what I put into this for a long time, even with all the renewed attention and that‚Äôs fine. Don‚Äôt worry about me, let‚Äôs take care of the team first.' by Simon

summary: Simon says FOV controls will exist.
mainText: 'Yes' by Simon

summary: Simon on controller support
mainText: 'Not yet' by Simon

summary: Simon gives details on localization
mainText: 'Using crowdin so the community should be able to translate as soon as possible' by Simon

summary: Players can set up dedicated servers at launch.
mainText: 'Yes' by Simon

summary: Simon confirms players can upgrade from one edition to a higher edition.
mainText: 'Yeah' by Simon

summary: Simon gives details on current steps to release.
mainText:
'Working on locking down the release date ASAP. We currently need to run hardware tests, wrap up legal docs, stabilize the game and fix a few security issues.

I‚Äôll have a precise answer by the end of next week. Pre-orders, name reservation and account creation will begin as well. All pricing will be announced, FYI base edition under $30 USD.

We are almost home.' by Simon

summary: Simon says the base edition of the game will be <$30
mainText: 'Base edition under $30' by Simon

You will see, cursebreaker üòâ' by Simon

summary: Simon shows commits on the engine over the years

'Here is proof that we are using a 4+ years old build of the game that we put together in the last few months.

I left in 2020.

We have a lot of catching up to do.' by Simon

summary: Simon says the tech supports a living world system for NPCs
mainText:
'Yes, the tech supports it. Just need to configure it all ' by Simon

(I remember being excited about how y'all would utilize AI to help NPCs bring life to their personality and interactions, creating a world that lives and breathes outside of the player (Like outlanders that were aiming and hunting a mob). Do yall still plan to do that?)

summary: Simon mentions that they will be adding more settings
mainText: 'Yeah, most of these options will be added in a setting before early access.' by Simon

summary: Simon clarifies the lack of fog in the gameplay video
mainText: 'Its because I had my view distance maxed out lol' by Simon

summary: Simon says controller support is planned, but doesn't exist yet.
mainText: 'not yet, planned obviously for accessibility reasons first' by Simon

summary: Simon says capes can change color, but Myne's will have a single color
mainText: 'Yes but I will force this color on your account' by Simon

summary: Simon says worldgen is infinite, but is currently turned off - can be turned on.
mainText:
'It's infinite but turned off atm because it doesn't look good on the map / it's confusing and not worth fixing because we are doing something different that will be explained in an upcoming blog post!
You can edit the config to turn it back on; the tech can make it work.' by Simon

(infinite, currently turned off, not worth fixing because they are doing something different....

"Something different" = worldgen 2? or what?)

summary: Slikey tweets info for Server Hosts
mainText: 'We are seeing a lot of server hosting providers reach out about day 1 Hytale support. We don't have the capacity to answer these right now and we will try to bring a hosting service manual out whenever we are less busy. We are targeting shipping the server for Java 25 and QUIC as the transport for the protocol.' by Slikey

summary: Polina talks about quick recoloring

summary: Slikey explains why the team is kept small.
mainText: 'We keep the team as small as possible and as large as necessary. Every hire we do is solving an acute and persistent problem that we could otherwise not solve and would be catastrophic to ignore.' by Slikey
